abstract:
Well known multiferroic compounds TbMnO3 and DyMnO3 show a strong coupling\ud
between antiferromagnetism and ferroelectricity. Magnetic susceptibility\ud
data for both compounds have been taken, showing large magnetic anisotropy,\ud
and providing strong evidence for the existence of crystal field effects up to 150 K\ud
above TN (∼40 K). Further evidence for crystal field effects is given by a measurement\ud
of the magnetic heat capacity of TbMnO3.\ud
A new group of multiferroic compounds, of the form Sm1−xYxMnO3, were discovered\ud
as part of this work. The parent compound, SmMnO3, is not ferroelectric\ud
and exhibits commensurate A-type antiferromagnetic order below TN∼58 K. By\ud
doping with Y on the Sm site, significant changes are seen in the magnetic properties,\ud
with a feature seen in the susceptibility data at ∼24 K for x = 0.4, 0.5\ud
corresponding with a peak in the dielectric constant and the onset of an electric\ud
polarisation (∼275 μC m−2 for Sm0.5Y0.5MnO3) along the crystallographic c-axis.\ud
The magnetoelectric coupling seen in Sm0.6Y0.4MnO3 and Sm0.5Y0.5MnO3 is linked\ud
to alterations in the local structure of the Mn-O octahedra, and in particular to\ud
the Mn-O-Mn bond angle, which can be tuned by Y doping.\ud
The zero-field electric properties of Sm1−xYxMnO3 (x = 0.4, 0.5) are very similar\ud
to those of TbMnO3, but show markedly different magnetic field dependence.\ud
Neutron diffraction and X-ray resonant scattering experiments were performed\ud
on Sm1−xYxMnO3 (x = 0, 0.4, 0.5) in order to attempt to determine the magnetic\ud
structure of the Y doped compounds. Evidence was found for a sinusoidally\ud
modulated collinear order of the Mn moments along the b-axis below TN1∼47 K,\ud
and cycloidal Mn order in the b-c plane below TN2∼24 K. This magnetic model is\ud
similar to that of TbMnO3, and it is proposed that the difference in the magnetic\ud
field dependence of the electric properties seen in TbMnO3 is due to coupling of\ud
the Mn moments with the strongly anisotropic Tb moments.\ud
The studies of Y doping were extended to the GdMnO3 system. Preliminary\ud
measurements show a similar magnetoelectric coupling in polycrystalline\ud
Gd1−xYxMnO3 (x = 0.1-0.4). Further research has been carried out on this group\ud
of compounds as a consequence of this work
